skill.name: clinicaltrials-database
skill.description: Query ClinicalTrials.gov via API v2. Search trials by condition, drug, location, status, or phase. Retrieve trial details by NCT ID, export data, for clinical research and patient matching.
skill.summary: Query ClinicalTrials.gov via API v2. Search trials by condition, drug, location, status, or phase. R...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The skill includes a Python script that makes HTTPS requests to the public ClinicalTrials.gov API. No credential access, persistence mechanisms, or code obfuscation were identified. Network access is required for core functionality and all requests go to the official NIH-managed API endpoint.

content.user_title: Search clinical trial data by filters
content.value_statement: Finding relevant trials across the registry is time consuming and inconsistent. This skill queries ClinicalTrials.gov API v2 with clear filters and reusable Python helpers.
actual_capabilities: Search studies by condition, intervention, location, sponsor, and status
Retrieve full study details by NCT ID
Paginate through all results with a helper function
Extract concise study summaries from API responses
Request CSV formatted results for export
limitations: Subject to API rate limits of about 50 requests per minute
Only public registry data is available
No authentication or private trial access

use_cases.title: Survey trial landscape
use_cases.description: Find active and completed trials for a disease area and track recent updates.

use_cases.title: Locate recruiting studies
use_cases.description: Identify recruiting trials for patient referrals in specific locations.

use_cases.title: Build datasets
use_cases.description: Export large result sets for trend analysis and reporting.

prompt_templates.title: Find recruiting trials
prompt_templates.prompt: Search ClinicalTrials.gov for recruiting trials on type 2 diabetes and show the top 5 titles and NCT IDs.

prompt_templates.title: Filter by intervention
prompt_templates.prompt: Find Phase 3 trials for Pembrolizumab that are recruiting or active and summarize status and phase.

prompt_templates.title: Geographic search
prompt_templates.prompt: List recruiting cancer trials located in New York and include facility name and city.

prompt_templates.title: Bulk export plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Retrieve all recruiting rare disease trials, handle pagination safely, and describe how to export to CSV.

output_examples.input: Find recruiting breast cancer trials and summarize key details.
output: Five trials found with NCT IDs and titles
Each entry lists current recruitment status
Phases and last update dates included
Notes where to review eligibility criteria

best_practices: Use page size 1000 to reduce requests
Check for missing fields before access
anti_patterns: Assuming every study has complete modules
Requesting private or unpublished trial data

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. It provides text guidance and a Python script that works across those tools.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: You are limited by public API rate limits and available registry fields.

faq.question: Can I integrate this into my pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes. You can call the Python functions and reuse the request patterns.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data?
faq.answer: No. It only sends queries to the public ClinicalTrials.gov API.

faq.question: How do I troubleshoot empty results?
faq.answer: Verify filters, reduce constraints, and check HTTP status codes for errors.

faq.question: How does it compare to manual site search?
faq.answer: It is faster, repeatable, and supports structured filters and exports.
